vulnerability.name: CTF Java Communiation Protocols
vulnerability.author: Michael Oultram, Paul Popa, Stefan Paui
vulnerability.description:
Installs some java communicaton protocosls that run on a prot inside of the VM. The protocols that are installed depend on how the ctf_java_protocols.pp file is configured, see the README for details on this. The protocols have a key that they will send to someone who completes the handshake correctly.
When the module is installed a new user 'charlie' is created. Insude of this users home directory /home/charlie/ is the source code for the protocols that have been installed. This source code does not contain the token however.
vulnerability.hint: View the source code for the protocol you are attacking (located in /home/charlie/protocol_name/) and identify the steps you would need to take to trick the server into sending you the token. Then write a program to perfrom this attack.
vulnerability.solution: The attacks can be heavily based on the source code, the attack code could even be a modification of the source code.
